citations.narrative:
The primary enclosure housing two caracals is in disrepair. The fence that is used to separate the two caracals, or used to
separate the animals for safe cleaning has a hole in it that is approximately six inches in diameter. There is another area
of fence next to the sliding door to close the two sides of the enclosure that has been bent back. Both of these areas have
sharp points.
Facilities that are not maintained in good repair and that have sharp points can cause injury to the animals inside the
enclosure.
The facility must be constructed of such material and of such strength as appropriate for the animals involved. The indoor
and outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals
from injury and to contain the animals.
To be corrected by May 7, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The primary enclosure housing two caracals is in disrepair. The fence that is used to separate the two caracals, or used to 
separate the animals for safe cleaning has a hole in it that is approximately six inches in diameter. There is another area 
of fence next to the sliding door to close the two sides of the enclosure that has been bent back. Both of these areas have 
sharp points. 
Facilities that are not maintained in good repair and that have sharp points can cause injury to the animals inside the 
enclosure. 
The facility must be constructed of such material and of such strength as appropriate for the animals involved. The indoor 
and outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals 
from injury and to contain the animals. 
To be corrected by May 7, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
